body:
Comment 6: 
@rsc,

If we use an api to open file and files does not exist, the api will return error=2
(ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND). It is just a number. We try convert it into a string before we
print this error to the screen. Since we are asking specifically for English version of
that error message now, sometimes it does not work, because, it appears, not all
computers have English error messages. We could use "native" error message in these
situations. Or we could just make error message ourselves, for example to be "Windows
retuned error #2" or similar. Either is better the what is happening now: "error 2
(FormatMessage failed with err=15100)".

Please, chose which one ("native" or "made up English") you want?

Alex
